newsitem.title: LATVIA: Unibanka up as Latvian share trade stays active.
newsitem.headline: Unibanka up as Latvian share trade stays active.

text.p: Trade on the Latvian bourse stayed active on Friday with leading bank Unibanka rising on strong trade.
Overall market turnover was 158,914 lats versus yesterday's 214,034 lats. Unibanka was the most traded on 65,000 lats and it rose to 2.60 lats from 2.50 lats.
The two other official list shares, Riga Transport Fleet and Staburadze, were also well traded.
RTF was stable at one lat on activity of 30,113 lats and Staburadze gained to 2.31 from 2.30 lats on turnover of 11,642 lats.
The Salacgriva fish cannery was the most active secondary market share on 23,000 lats but was stable at 2.30 lats.
Daugavpils Chain turned over 16,070 lats and climbed to 1.19 lats from 1.16 lats while fish cannery Kaija traded 3,150 lats for a one santime gain to 1.21 lats.

Other active secondary market stocks included the Lode Brick firm on 2,904 lats and it rose to 1.21 lats from 1.11 lats and the soft drinks firm Veldze dipped 1.5 percent to 64 santimes on business of 1,920 lats.
Jekabpils Sugar traded 1,777 lats and gained to 50 santimes from 45 santimes.
